required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Motivation for Cocaine and Non-Drug Reinforcers: Targeting Glutamate Homeostasis

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: This study will determine the initial efficacy, safety and tolerability of n-acetylcysteine as a pharmacotherapy for cocaine dependence. A rigorous, inpatient human laboratory study will be conducted in which the subjective, physiological and reinforcing effects of cocaine are evaluated during maintenance on placebo and n-acetylcysteine.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacodynamics Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Basic Science

primary_outcome.time_frame: After at least seven days of placebo or n-acetylcysteine maintenance
primary_outcome.description: The reinforcing effects of cocaine will be determined using a self-administration procedure in which subjects choose to take previously sampled doses. Reinforcing effects are measured during maintenance on placebo and n-acetylcysteine.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 sessions over approximately 2 week inpatient admissions
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects will complete subjective effects measures during six sessions while they are admitted to our inpatient unit. These items will ask about drug effects and general mood.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily over approximately 2 week inpatient admissions
secondary_outcome.description: Physiological measures will be completed daily while subjects are admitted to our inpatient unit. Physiological measures include heart rate and blood pressure.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily over approximately two weeks of inpatient admission.
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects will complete a side effects questionnaire daily while they reside on the inpatient unit. Side Effects questions will query subjects about common effects of centrally active medications.

arm_group.description: Subjects will be maintained on oral placebo.
Subjects will be maintained on oral n-acetylcysteine.

intervention.description: The pharmacodynamic effects of cocaine will be determined during maintenance on placebo and n-acetylcysteine.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Current cocaine use
- Current cigarette smoker
Exclusion Criteria:
- Abnormal screening outcome (e.g., ECG, blood chemistry result) that study physicians deem clinically significant
- Current or past histories of substance abuse or dependence that are deemed by the study physicians to interfere with study completion
- History of serious physical disease, current physical disease, impaired cardiovascular functioning, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, history of seizure or current or past histories of serious psychiatric disorder that in the opinion of the study physician would interfere with study participation will be excluded from participation
- Females not currently using effective birth control
- Contraindications to cocaine or n-acetylcysteine
- History of schizophrenia in first degree relative

facility.name: University of Kentucky Laboratory of Human Behavioral Pharmacology
